title: [edu] IEU CD204-ARCH202 project gallery
content:
IEU CD204-ARCH202 project gallery

“ [The Language of the Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503010709/http:/homes.ieu.edu.tr/~asegalini/0607/t2-arch2-project1.jpg) ”  
12.02.2007 – 19.02.2007

My gratitude goes to my associates Gül Kaçmaz Erk & Selma Göker for having made this project feasible, and to all the 2nd year students involved, for having undertaken the task in one week only, and with admirable results. Last but not least I’d like to thank Dr. Hakan Ertep & Dr. Tevfik Balcioglu for their understanding.

The letters of the alphabet, the characters of a typeface are building blocks ; as well as I believe that writing is architecture, _may graphic design & typography not be banned_.

author: Alessandro Segalini

comments.content:
Interesting preponderance of D’s there, presumably the absence of lowercase was a part of the brief.

Tim

Yes, it was.  
The ’D’ for those groups was the choice of the _circle-based_ letterform (besides _triangle_ & _square_).  
In the gallery the images of the architectures are just reported as text references.

I see, I think, picking three letterforms based (loosely) on triangle, square and circle.  
Fun project.

Tim

Yes, one thing I used to like about Lawrence Parker’s (KRS-One) was his concept of “ [edutainment](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503010709/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edutainment),” and that was the first time I heard that word.

Wonderful, fantastic, faboulous great. :). Very expressing and inspiring :). Love it.
